name: Yvone Taylor
text: I have had nothing but good experience with this company..My Siding Looks Great!

name: Ace Brio
text: I work at American wallzone supply

name: Casey Jonas
text:
The sales rep (David) sent me a text message saying his manager was needing a check for materials that had been left at my house by a contractor who walked off the job. There was never any agreement between myself and WallZone to directly purchase any materials. I had been told by WallZone in Huntsville that the contractor, not WallZone, owned the materials and they had been paid for. I asked David why he tried to get me to purchase something that was already paid for by the contractor, and he refused to answer my question.

I then called a manager in Pelham, Mike, and was informed that the contractor already paid for the materials, WallZone had no money in the materials whatsoever (and wasn't needing a check from anyone), and that nobody had ever asked David to contact me regarding the materials. I was then told by the manager, who was laughing at David's attempt to steal from me, that WallZone would have just credited the contractor's account had they received a check from me. How WallZone is in business when their sales representatives try to steal money from homeowners is beyond me.

name: NameHidden ForPrivacy
text:
Bought a brand new Stihl chainsaw from this establishment.   After 20 minutes of running the saw broke and needed a new head.

First Stihl gave me a hard time about the saw, made me take pictures of an obviously brand new saw and after a lot of hull-a-ba-loo agreed to fix the saw.

Then they had Electrical Outlet fix it.  It took Electrical Outlet six months to fix the saw.

Went back into Electrical Outlet today (a year later after the saw fiasco) and put $300 dollars worth of material into my buggy.

I went to get a log chain and requested help from the owner, a Mr. Alexander.

He helped me get the chain and I requested help obtaining hooks to put on the end of the chain.

I had some reservations about the eye hooks, such as would they be as sturdy as the chain itself.  What type was better, etc.

During this question session three men came up to us and interrupted our conversation.  Mr. Alexander then just left me standing there with a couple of different hooks in my hand and walked away to discuss college football with what were apparently his friends.

So, I shopped a bit more, patiently waited at the front desk while these four people gabbed about college football.

When Mr. Alexander finally decided to check me out I indicated I was not happy with his leaving me standing there.

While explaining this I did not raise my voice or act rudely, I simply told him I wasn't happy with the service level provided.

It was at this time that Mr. Alexander decided to go ballistic on me.

I got a good reaming out by him.  For good measure he also tossed in a few choice four letter words.

I told him that I was having a difficult time being calm with him.

To that he pointed at the door and told me to get out.

I then told him about my chain saw experience and that I had refrained from criticizing the store about the poor service because one of his young employees had been very nice to me during a weather emergency we had April 27th, 2011.

Once again I got told where the door was and to use it.

So, I proceeded to do so.

As I was opening the door he shouted at me "You must be another one of those Terry's".  I promptly told him who I was and spelled my name out for him.

I try to support local businesses, but he effectively sent me next door to Tractor Supply (where I got everything I came to town for anyway).  Guess it will be Tractor Supply or Lowes in the big city from here on out.

Good luck with your attitude Mr. Alexander.  It will take your business straight down!

They gave us new material got over half the material up and it’s all warped again! So it’s been a wasted week, checked this material and all they did was put good boards on the outside of the bundles and all the bad materials directly in the middle.  Very very unhappy. name: Justin Rodgers
text:
Despite having good stuff; my mother, brother and I were chased out by one of the managers with a really foul attitude.  (full story and quotes on facebook)

My mother got us excited to drive TWO HOURS to see this place but when we got there, one of the managers singled me and my brother out separately asking "Are you going to buy anything?" as well as some other angry, uncalled for aggression.  When we said "No sir" he told us "you need to leave, right now!"  We were escorting our mother because it's in a bad part of town!  When my mother came to inquire about something she wanted to purchase this man told her he was with someone (another employee) and couldn't "deal with her" and she would just have to wait.  He was very rude and angry with her too.

We drove two hours so my mother could spend a LOT OF MONEY on things there but we were chased out within 5 minutes!!   We were treated like bums begging for money!  We would not have driven halfway across the state to kick your tires!  The things you said to my family will NOT FLY with me!  Uncalled for and unprofessional!

There are lots of antique stores closer to our small town, all which treat us like customers not garbage.  We try to buy at least 2 or 3 things whenever we visit.  We will not be coming back here though.

name: Christine Cole
text: Vintage Station is my new favorite place to find unique, salvaged, re-purposed home decor. It's also overflowing with unique, one-of-a-kind antiques & beautiful custom order furniture. If you can dream it, they can build it! And if you want to build it yourself they have barnwood, salvaged windows & doors, & plenty of odds & ends to help you create your own masterpiece!

name: Brian Svencer
text: We were very excited about visiting after seeing all the advertising and neat pictures posted. When arriving the owner approached us and apologized for it being disorderly. Another nice gentleman approached us and informed us of all the areas available to be seen. While speaking to both men we informed him of the interest we had in the reclaimed lumber and that we custom make them ourselves back home. He gave us pricing on what he had and told us to check out the shop area and to let him know if we needed help with any lumber. We also refinish furniture for a living and are on the look out for good fixer uppers to refinish and resell. So we walked around the top and bottom floor. They had nothing of good quality to choose from. We then made our way out to the "OPEN TO THE PUBLIC COME ON IN" shop area. The craftsmanship done by his employees was great and we were simply admiring the work done. NO PHONE, NO CAMERA simply looking and out of no where the owner comes up to my husband and tells him "IF YOU ARENT HERE TO BUY YOU NEED TO LEAVE" "WE BUILD CUSTOM TABLES FOR CLIENTS" "WE ARE A CHRISTIAN BASED COMPANY AND WE DONT NEED ANYONE STEALING OUR DESIGNS" Now if I was taking pictures of this mans work I could understand his hostility but we weren't we were simply browsing his shop, custom tables, painted furniture and doors as we were told to do. Then he approaches me and tells me if I'm not here to buy anything from him to leave right now and never come back. He turns back around to my husband who was holding our 1 year old in his arms and leans in like he is about to grab him and yells to my husband to walk faster and to get out. While this place looks great in pictures it is not what they display online. How this man stays in business talking to customers the way he does is unreal to me. Christian business?!? You are a hotheaded joke. I have browsed the other reviews and this is not the first time or the last that this man has ran out good paying customers.

name: Campbell Dunbar
text: Their work is beautiful, but when we have spent hours going through hundreds of doors during an Alabama summer heat wave to find a few matching pairs and the owner couldn't even spend 3 minutes with us discussing what might be a fair price for all of it I knew we wouldn't be back. We were told to let them know when we were ready and the owner would come out and talk to us about prices. When he did he was very rude, inconsiderate, and his pricing system made no sense. He wanted $75 per door on every door we had, even though some were in much worse shape than others. We came prepared to spend a pretty penny and ended up spending a fraction of that because of his attitude. We won't be back. The drive out there is not worth the hassle and we do not recommend that anyone else waste their time either.

The employees are friendly and helpful. Smiling. Need something, ask... If they have it, they know where it's at.
Have anything from paint to shingles, tools to hardware and fasteners, from doors to hoteater heaters, from plumbing supplies to electrical supplies.

name: Jaime 0212
text:
Very disappointed in the service.  I purchased a NEW dishwasher December 21st.  Marquez was extremely helpful!  I can't rave about him enough.  My issue came when I was told my dishwasher was in stock in Bham but due to the holidays their 1 installer wouldn't be able to install until after all the holidays.  Okay, I understood the desire to take a break and be with family.  After January 4th I still never heard from anyone to schedule my install.  I finally called on January on January 8th to track down someone to help get this installed.  They were able to come install my dishwasher on the 13th.  The gentlemen that installed my NEW Bosch dishwasher made me aware that the 3rd row was shipped with broken clips so it wouldn't work but that's okay they would have someone come right back out to fix the issue.  After several days of no communication I once again called the store and was told oh yea Shane can come out on January 25th.  Great! Finally I will be able to use my new dishwasher properly.  Shane arrives on the 25th with a 3rd row for the dishwasher.  He was NOT informed properly of the problem and only had the drawer itself.  So once again Im left with a dishwasher that can not be utilized to the fullest.  Shane tells me he will go back to the shop and grab the clips off of another dishwasher and be back to fix the issue.  I wait and wait.  I finally get a hold of Mike on February 5th.  He informs me that the job has been listed as complete!!!  There was no order to get new clips there was nothing listed as needing to still be fixed.  Mike tells me that he will call me back before the end of day OR call me on Monday February 8th to tell me what can be done.  Again, I wait!  I called today the 12th a FULL MONTH after my dishwasher was installed.  Mike tells me oh those clips are on back order.  I asked for some type of date as to expect them he states could be end of February.
My issue is the POOR COMMUNICATION!!!!   1st. the installer NEVER reported the correct issue with my dishwasher had he done so properly Shane would never have come to my house with the wrong part.  2nd Shane completed the job.  This is a HUGE FAIL!!!  3rd. Mike never contacted me to let me know there is no part readily available and it will be back ordered.  When I reached out as I've had to do every since they took my money back in December Mike acted a little confused to why I would be calling.

I expect better when paying for a top of the line appliance.  I've gotten better service from a big box store!  I understand parts get broken in the box and no one is aware but this should've been taken care of in January! This was NOT a warranty issue as it was delivered to me broken!!! The product was not ever used.  I am NOT happy that I will have to wait until March to fully use my dishwasher the proper way.  The whole reason I came to All South was the earliest Bob Wallace could get the dishwasher installed was March 4th!!!  If I had known I would be stuck until March to begin with I would've gave Bob Wallace my money!

name: Jason Newell
text:
Allsouth was the appliance sub for our builder (who is outstanding, by the way).  All they had to do was install three appliances.  THREE.  The only thing these jag-offs got right was the delivery of the appliances and *sliding in* our new oven.  The dishwasher and microwave were both dropped.  This was obvious because (a) we saw the palette in our garage prior to installation, (b) one side of the palette was "injured", (c) the corresponding sides of the appliances from that side of the palette were both broken.

To add insult to injury, they didn't use the granite counter installation kit for the dishwasher.  This would help considering they don't want to fix the broken feet.  Now, when you open a loaded dishwasher, the whole machine rotates thereby "dishcharging" the bottom rack of dishes out onto your floor.  This is entertaining to guests.

The microwave is also fun.  The plate does not rotate properly so you can always tell when it's in use because of the "thump-thump" made by the turntable, much like a broken record but without the repetitive music.  Also, the clock is crooked so you can't tell if it's AM or PM (which actually matters during the winter when it's dark at 5AM and 5PM).  And the oven vent built into the microwave is broken so it slides right out after only unfastening two screws when it should be held together by four screws.  The other two take bits of the broken plastic housing with them.

Normally I wouldn't care because these appliances are "builder grade" but it's the principle of the matter.  Allsouth is not interested in fixing or replacing the appliances which can be done EXTREMELY EASILY when you're a flippin' vendor.  They're only interested in minimalist work, single trips, and offering to "send out an inspector" which was already been done by the builder who verified that the pieces are indeed broken.  We're guessing Allsouth doesn't trust the builder that hired them in the first place.  They also will not come out on your time, only their time, so if you work and are busy from 8am to 5pm, you can bet you'll never see nor hear from them again.

name: JoJo Campbell
text:
Always had a great experience from Allsouth Appliance until today.  I called a week ago and requested service on my refrigerator and they scheduled me for today, between 8 and 12.  I rearranged my schedule so that I could be home for the four hour period. I decided at 9:00, this morning, I should call and confirm.  I was told their service technician is out sick for a couple of weeks and they had transferred my appt to "Service Care" in Birmingham.  I asked for a number to contact them for a confirmation.  I called Service Care and spoke to a really nice many who was shocked that I was expecting them today because they had just gotten the information yesterday.   He said they are in Birmingham so they are trying to schedule all Huntsville appointments for the same day and MAYBE they would be able to get here next week.
I certainly understand when an employee is out sick that the the schedule has to be changed but I am disappointed in Allsouth that they did not contact me to let me know that my appt had been transferred to someone else AND that it would not occur today.  I took time off from work to be here and now will have to do it again for when they are able to come and make the repair.

name: Wood Kirk Works
text: Even though the staff seemed knowledgeable about the products offered here, the vibe of this business is pretentious to say the least. I came in with my girlfriend and her son. We came within 6 ft of several middle-aged employees and weren't greeted once. I had to approach the counter and ask for what I needed (which they didn't have) then I was left to my own devices finding anything else useful in the store. This could have been tolerable if it weren't for the same employees greeting other customers with warm, inviting hellos and good wishes.

resp.text: We apologize that you did not feel seen and appreciated in our store. We pride ourselves on customer service, whether its to contractors who come in every day or first time shoppers. We are fully open to the public and value our customers equally. We failed to demonstrate that. We hope you'll give us another opportunity to earn your business.

name: Jabaria Dent
text: Good customer service. And their wood prices beat Lowe's

resp.text: Thank you for this review. We hope this helps new customers know that, while we are not a global corporation like Lowe's, our prices are  very often lower than the big box stores.

name: A T
text: I ordered fence pickets from them, paid over phone, and had delivered a week later no problem. I call back a few days later to ask if I can get a few more and am told they haven't had any in weeks and I must be confused about who I got them from. I call back the next day and am told there's 30 left but they don't take payments over the phone. It sounds to me like the employees each have their own rules they go by 🙄

resp.text: Hi. We apologize for our poor communication. We should have done a better job explaining the fence board situation. The market for fence boards is extremely turbulent right now. We are accustomed to having a ready supply in stock and ordinarily we would be happy to take an order over the phone and hold the inventory. However, because fence boards are in such high demand and we haven't been able to source them with the dependability of the pre-COVID days, we are discouraging our staff from reserving them, because the last thing we want is a customer to pay for a product, expect it, and we not have it in stock when they are ready for delivery.

name: Andrew O'Dell
text: Good lumber at a good price, knowledgeable and very helpful staff.

name: Manuela Smith
text: Was disappointed by employees knowledge and selling me the wrong tool to fit the screws I bought there.

resp.text: Hi Manuela. We remember you coming in yesterday. We apologize for disappointing you. It's often difficult to discern the size of a screw or bolt from a cell phone image. We suggested a product that would work on a range of bolt sizes, but unfortunately we didn't guess right. Thank you for your business and again we are sorry we weren't able to help you select the right product the first time.

name: Ray Keene
text: Great customer service.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Mr. Keene. We appreciate your business.

name: Priscilla Young

name: Michelle Morgan
text:
We have been remodeling our home and I have been looking for a front door for about 2 months now with no luck and very little enthusiasm to sell me a door.  I happen to stumble across Mobile Lumber and Yvette was a breath of fresh air when it came to picking out the perfect front door.  She was very knowledgeable, nice, fast and her follow through was great.  Within 24 hours she had my pricing and order placed for me, even saved me a trip back to West Mobile by handling everything over the phone.  Excellent customer service, I only wish we would had checked Mobile Lumber out at the beginning of our remodel adventure.

Thanks so much Yvette,

Michelle Morgan

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words and for taking the time to give us this review. We appreciate it and so does Yvette. If there's anything else we can help you with in the future, please let us know.

text: Went there a couple of Saturdays ago to look at front doors. Complete waste of time. We were not greeted when walking in, no one came over to assist us, or acknowledged us when we left. Not much selection out on the floor for what we were looking for and no customer service was offered.

resp.text: Hi Heather. We pride ourselves on our customer service, which is one factor that differentiates us from the big box stores. We failed to provide that experience to you and we apologize. Our team is very knowledgeable in exterior door options and we regret that we aren't able to help you select the perfect door for your home. We appreciate you coming in and hope you'll give us another chance.

name: 2SSRS 5th Gen
text: Prices are kinda high. But they also aren't MASKHOLES.

resp.text: Thank you for the review. We agree, lumber prices are on the high side right now, but that's across the industry. Lumber is a commodity and prices fluctuate daily (sometimes hourly) depending on the market. We value our reputation for pricing our building materials extremely competitively. It's part of what has kept us around since 1975.

name: OBrien Holcombe
text: This place has been here for decades and at least 4 of those decades I have used them for many project needs. Good folks, wonderful environment and the men in the yard do not get enough praise. So here is to you gentlemen for doing such an outstanding job day in and day out.

resp.text: Brien, we certainly appreciate your support and patronage over the past 4 decades! We will pass this praise along to our guys in the yard. If we can do anything to make your experience even better, please don't hesitate to let us know.

name: Detroit Q
text: Some of the worst customer service I have ever experienced. I had never been to this place so I was unsure if customers were allowed to walk through the warehouse. Naturally I ask the clerk at the desk or at least tried to ask and when I say this guy gave the impression that he us too busy to deal with me. The guy wouldn't even stop typing or even give me the common decency of looking at me when he responded. At first I was thinking maybe I was asking to much due to me being a vet and being so use to people at least looking at you to acknowledge your existence but when he proceeded to continue typing and responding with very short answers I knew then it wasn't me. Everyone is entitled to a bad day and I get that but you work in the customer service industry for God sakes. A little hospitality would go a long way. I guess it's on to the next lumber yard.

name: Paul Miller
text: I shopped around and ended up doing my business here.  Well priced and very helpful

name: Mark James
text: Good place to get all your buildings needs

name: Katherine Winslow Austill
text:
The items I purchased were not available & what was available was not 1st quality.

None of the items offered for pick-up were straight & defect free.

I had to be very firm in my demand for a full refund.

The experience took over 1.5 hours to:
1) place the order
2) have the order hand written
3) pay for the order
4) drive around to pick up the order
5) walk inside and inform of the poor quality and insufficient quantity
6) walk back out to pick up to show inside sales the poor quality and insufficient quantity
7) walk back inside to ask - then demand a refund
8) wait while the entire order was again hand written and wait for my refund

A complete waste of time.
1.5 hours to accomplish nothing.

resp.text: Hi Katherine. We hate hearing that you had such a bad experience at our store! We are trying to track down your transaction to figure out what happened so it won't happen in the future. Providing an excellent customer service experience is very important to us! Would you be willing to talk to our store manager Lee to help us understand what happened? You can reach him at 661-8000. Again, we are sorry for any inconvenience we caused you.

text: I was extremely impressed with the service. Cory got the order right the first time. He also remember my first and last name on the account from 3 weeks ago. You just can't  find this type of service alot these day. Everything from the materials being delivered on time to the material I over ordered and returned, the ladies in the accounting department were super nice and they double checked everything on the credit back. I just can't say enough about the service and that's why City Lumber Home Center and Lumberyard # 2 get 5 stars. Will be doing business with you again. Thank you and GOD BLESS.

resp.text: Thanks!  Corey does a great job for us and we appreciate you.

name: Gene Roop
text: Great people. Sent an email on a Sunday afternoon, not during business hours, expecting a response possibly Monday or Tuesday to get an answer on availability for a particular type of siding and where I might could find it. I received an email back not only on a Sunday, but within two hours of sending this email I received a email back with detailed information. Not only did I learn that that particular siding was no longer produced by the manufacturer, I was offered advise and the name of a salesman to call Monday morning to see if they couldn't find something that would work for me. Excellent customer service!!

resp.text: Gene, we are delighted to help anytime we can and are thankful for your kind words.  People like you, suporting local small businesses, is what keeps us going!

text: Amazing customer service.   Jason and Dylan went out of their way to help me out.  Even better every time I’ve been at the shop EVERYONE was so nice and never made me feel uncomfortable because I don’t know a lot about lumber.  I love supporting a local business, makes it even easier when they have superior products and service.

resp.text: Thank you so much!  I wish more people realized we help more than just contractors and builders.  Thank you for entrusting us to help and I'm proud of my team for making your experience one worth bragging about.  Thanks again :)

name: Allen catdaddy V
text:
Absolutely terrible customer service. I called 11/20/19 to get a lumber package delivered to save some time. I knew it would be a bit more expensive but more convenient. Delivery was quick and early 11/21/19 unfortunately delivery is at wrong address 100 yards from where it should be and about 15 boards were incorrect. Still no biggie just let them know and I would think it would be taken care of. First call was 8:40 am. Left a message for Dino with another salesman and on his cell phone. Second call was about 12:30 pm, third call was at 3:00 I was told he was still with a customer. I asked the person on the phone to please tell him so that I could hear him answer I needed a call back today, and he did. 3:30 pm Dino calls I explain 15 boards were to be pressure treated and the delivery was in the wrong spot (address) I was then argued with that I didn’t order pressure treated I wrote down the prices quoted and if it wasn’t p.t it was expensive white wood. He put me on hold when he came back to the phone he said the contractor that came in and paid told him the location. I explained it was all done over the phone and there was only me. Where he described is exactly where I told him to put it. Unfortunately that’s not where it was put. He said he would call me back and get it straightened out. No call back, so 11/22/19 I called and left a message with a nice young lady for the sales manager.(I was told his name is Jason).No call back!! I go to see if the package has been moved that afternoon. I have pressure treated wood but package not moved. So much for convenience. Now I will have to pay someone to move the wood. Oh yeah still no call back or invoice. Never again!!

Update, still no call. 11/27/19

resp.text: The pictures of the delivery show the load to be at the end of the gravel driveway by the barn and the exact material delivered that was paid for on the ticket.  I'll find out more info on Monday and be in touch.

name: Stacie DeWolfe
text: I called Greens about two days prior to coming in and asked the lady who answered the telephone about some prices on dog ear planks. She indicated that they were only one size and that the cost would be $2.86 a plank. I went to Greens this morning to purchase the planks that I needed to complete my fence. I counted that I needed 144 planks for my front fence and about 15 additional to complete the side fence for a total of 161 planks. I told the cashier what I wanted and she indicated to another employee she needed to call someone and ask if there was a limit. SHe called the owners daughter and I was told she would allow me to purchase but  100 planks. Do what? No sign that says there is a limit, she never mentioned it to me on the phone when I called so she just decided that she would :"allow" me to purchase 100 because she wanted to save the others she had just in case a contractor of hers needed them.. Are you kidding. Is this the way to do business? So my money is not good enough, so you want to save them for a contractor that might or might not need them and I need them. I will never shop there again.

name: Amanda
text: Started off with a great experience at the sales office. While the two employees working the office could not provide a solution to my issue they asked for me to leave my contact information with them, and provided the business card for a coworker that might be able to help. I was told they would have that person give me a call to set up an appointment to have someone come out to my house to see if they can troubleshoot my issue and possibly come up with a solution. After nearly a week there has been no communication from them. Instead, I had to call the person on the business card only to then be told he was not the right person and that he needed to have someone else call me back instead. Still waiting on that call back. My problem is that I bought a set of glass fireplace doors for my fireplace that I should be able to easily install myself, but they do not fit by just a few millimeters in height. I have double checked that I got the correct doors. I know the manufacturer and model number of my fireplace, so I bought the coordinating doors for my fireplace. I am worried that the fireplace and/or tile surround was not done properly and therefore might be the cause of my issue. Please beware this company installs the fireplaces and does the tile/brick work for Lowder New Homes, so if you are a Lowder homeowner you could run into similar issues in the future!!

The staff showed us a previously unconsidered option for our new patio, ultra hard and thick porcelain! It's been installed a few years now and we're extremely grateful we didn't go with real or fake stone.
Also, they carry Fire Magic grills, a very high quality American made line of grills.
